text: 'Anti-woke' provides the best guidance of any political heuristic.
Secularism not seriously being a thing is the most important discovery of the early third millennium.
... If you already think religions are a problem due to their smug dogmatism, wait until you try religions in self-denial.
No. You're mistakenly assuming access to a logical apparatus transcending religious tradition.
You have to see that treating religion as a sociological category is entirely avoiding the real issue, right?
On the contrary, 'transcending religious tradition' is pure metaphysics (in the critical sense).
Some species of Protestant sectarian (which is of course cool).
Anything coming out of AI is (cladistically) a Protestant sect. ...
... Neural networks are the application of spontaneous order (The Invisible Hands) to computation. Weber would have nodded them through.
There's a way this could be phrased that is simultaneously more generous and more theo-historically sophisticated.
He's an ally, of course.
Full of arcane treasure, though. Persuading Moldbug of his deep Calvinism is among my deepest ambitions.
The progressive cult culminating in Woke made a travesty of secularism quite independently of western ethnodemographic ruin (and in order to pursue western ethnodemographic ruin).
If by 'Secularism' you mean Reformed Christianity.
... settling the problem correctly as theological cladistics. His error was to assume that his own position transcended this.
Reluctant to pontificate because my only access to them is in translation, but Religion and Nothingness seems to be the capstone text.
'Supernatural' is the kind of criterion for religion applied only after thoroughly losing the plot.
Are there non-religious 'belief systems'? No (of course not). The Jacobins still understood this when they initiated the Cult of Reason.
Reddit is in truth the dumbest religion.
So, a Quaker?
You already did this with 'systems of belief'.
So post-religious they have 'In this House we Believe ...' lawn-signs.
